Just stop being a linux hick and install VCS Express on a Windows partition :P[/quote]

item.title: [C#] Leet rave/techno/electronic music generator
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:256722”]I used gmcs to build it, mcs gives me some strange error:

mopar@linux-laptop:~/projects/c#/techno$ mcs techno.cs techno.cs(2,26): error CS0234: The type or namespace name `Generic' does not exist in the namespace `System.Collections'. Are you missing an assembly reference? techno.cs(2,26): error CS0234: The type or namespace name `Generic' does not exist in the namespace `System.Collections'. Are you missing an assembly reference? Compilation failed: 2 error(s), 0 warnings mopar@linux-laptop:~/projects/c#/techno$ gmcs techno.cs techno.cs(12,17): warning CS0219: The variable `i' is assigned but its value is never used Compilation succeeded - 1 warning(s) mopar@linux-laptop:~/projects/c#/techno$ ./techno.exe

Still no sound though, strange.[/quote]
You aren’t referencing the System.Collections.Generic assembly. You can just remove the “using System.Collection.Generic;” line, as I don’t think the program actually uses it (link is broken).

Read full topic

item.title: [C#] Leet rave/techno/electronic music generator
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I used gmcs to build it, mcs gives me some strange error:

mopar@linux-laptop:~/projects/c#/techno$ mcs techno.cs techno.cs(2,26): error CS0234: The type or namespace name `Generic' does not exist in the namespace `System.Collections'. Are you missing an assembly reference? techno.cs(2,26): error CS0234: The type or namespace name `Generic' does not exist in the namespace `System.Collections'. Are you missing an assembly reference? Compilation failed: 2 error(s), 0 warnings mopar@linux-laptop:~/projects/c#/techno$ gmcs techno.cs techno.cs(12,17): warning CS0219: The variable `i' is assigned but its value is never used Compilation succeeded - 1 warning(s) mopar@linux-laptop:~/projects/c#/techno$ ./techno.exe

Still no sound though, strange.

Read full topic

item.title: [C#] Leet rave/techno/electronic music generator
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Oh, that is supposed to happen rarely, when the random number is 0. Essentially means that the frequency for the beep is below 37Hz, and the program crashes, or the frequency for the beep is too high. I’ll fix in a sec.

Read full topic

item.title: [C#] Leet rave/techno/electronic music generator
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unhandled Exception: System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Argument is out of range. Parameter name: frequency at System.Console.Beep (Int32 frequency, Int32 duration) [0x00000] at TechnoGen.Program.get_R () [0x00000] at TechnoGen.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000]

I’ve written one C# program, I had to look up how to compile it again. Did you test it? What does this mean?

Read full topic
